subject: Perl Rocks
header: Here in England, two long weeks of school holiday ending today. It is Monday bank holiday in England today. From tomorrow, back to school run in the morning and afternoon whilst fasting as it is Ramadan going on.
Let's enjoy the last day of the break and not worry about anything else.

In the last one week or so, I have been sharing Perl sample code post on various social platforms, like The Perl Community, Perl Programmers, Twitter and LinkedIn. It has generated lots of buzz on the subject. Lots of new ideas, at least to me, came to the front.
For those who missed it, let me share some of them here.
Have fun with Perl and share your experience with us. You take care of yourself and your loved one.

entries.author: flavio_poletti
entries.text: Flavio picked up the most complicated topic this week, PerlMagick and PDF. Happy to see the solution in the end.
entries.title: PerlMagick PDF pages
How much is that BLÃ…HAJ in the (terminal) window?
entries.author: mark_gardner
entries.text: Welcome back to blogging after the short break. I find it hard to follow the code but the end result is fun.

entries.title: Using Test Results For CI Optimisation
entries.author: mark_terry
entries.text: Interesting discussion about CI and its common problems. A nice introduction to Circle CI and how it addresses the common issues of CI. Highly Recommended.

entries.title: Installing Perl with perlbrew
entries.author: ali
entries.text: Ever played with perlbrew in the past, if not checkout this post to get you going.

entries.author: flavio_poletti
entries.text: Short and sweet introduction to the CPAN module Imager::QRCode.
entries.title: Imager::QRCode

entries.author: flavio_poletti
entries.text: I must admit, it is new to me, never seen it before LavaRnd::*. Thank you for introduction.
entries.title: Echoes from the past: LavaRnd

chapters.title: The Weekly Challenge
chapters.header: The Weekly Challenge by Mohammad Anwar will help you step out of your comfort-zone. You can even win prize money of $50 Amazon voucher by participating in the weekly challenge. We pick one winner at the end of the month from among all of the contributors during the month. The monthly prize is kindly sponsored by Peter Sergeant of PerlCareers.

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Welcome to a new week with a couple of fun tasks: "Abecedarian Words" and "Pangrams". If you are new to the weekly challenge, why not join us and have fun every week. For more information, please read the FAQ.
entries.title: The Weekly Challenge - 161

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Enjoy a quick recap of last week's contributions by Team PWC dealing with the "Four Is Magic" and "Equilibrium Index" tasks in Perl and Raku. You will find plenty of solutions to keep you busy.
entries.title: RECAP - The Weekly Challenge - 160

entries.author: colin_crain
entries.text: Perl Solutions Review by Colin Crain.
entries.title: Perl Review - Perl Weekly Challenge - 156

entries.author: adam_russell
entries.text: Clever use of recursive function to solve the Four Is Magic task. Twisted my brain with pack/unpack too. Thanks for sharing the knowledge.
entries.title: Four is Equilibrium

entries.author: alexander_pankoff
entries.text: A thorough task analysis done by Alexander. It made it look so simple. Keep it up great work.
entries.title: No way around four

entries.author: alexander_pankoff
entries.text: A compact and clean solution. Also the explanation is thorough. Thanks for sharing.
entries.title: Steps to recovering the Equilibrium in your lists

entries.text: Cool use of multi sub of Raku. Always pleasure to have sharing the power of Raku. Thank you.
entries.title: Challenge 160

entries.text: Using graph to explain the task is really cool. Thank you for your effort every week.
entries.title: The Magic Equilibrium

entries.text: Good use of CPAN module to extend the scope of the task. Thank you for sharing your knowledge.
entries.title: Sign of the Four

entries.author: colin_crain
entries.text: I find the task analysis by Colin to be very thought provoking. Highly recommended. Thank you Colin.
entries.title: All Things in Balance

entries.author: dave_jacoby
entries.text: Dave's initial comment about the week number 160 is very interesting, never thought about it. I also like how he promotes the method signature in Perl. Keep it up great work.
entries.title: Does That Make Friendship Equal Four?

entries.author: flavio_poletti
entries.text: I noticed something new in this Raku solution '.tclc', never seen this before. Keep it up great work.
entries.title: PWC160 - Four Is Magic

entries.author: flavio_poletti
entries.text: I liked the compact solution in Raku. Taking the full advantage of Raku language. Very smart. Thank you.
entries.title: PWC160 - Equilibrium Index

entries.author: james_smith
entries.text: I admire the quality of solutions shared by James every week. Plenty to learn from, thanks for sharing your knowledge with us.
entries.title: The Weekly Challenge 160

entries.author: laurent_rosenfeld
entries.text: As expected Laurent shared very interesting aspect of the task 'Four Is Magic'. Interesting catch. Keep it up great work.

entries.text: Luca has been great promoter of Raku language. I liked his one-liner in Raku, very interesting. Thanks for sharing the knowledge.

entries.text: I am big fan of short and simple blog style, to the point, no gimmicks. Thanks for your contributions.

chapters.title: Perl Tutorial
chapters.header: A section for newbies and for people who need some refreshing of their Perl knowledge. If you have questions or suggestions about the articles, let me know and I'll try to make the necessary changes. The included articles are from the Perl Maven Tutorial and are part of the Perl Maven eBook.
